About

I am a machine learning researcher and engineer, starting at Persimmons on chiplet design in February 2026 in San Jose, California. I graduated from NYU in December 2025 with a B.A. in Computer Science and have been working with Professor Andrew G. Wilson and his research group. Check out my resume!

Recent News

  • January 2026: “A Unification of Discrete, Gaussian, and Simplicial Diffusion” and “Understanding and Relaxing the Limitations of Transformers for Linear Algebra” got accepted to ICLR!
  • December 2025: Our paper, A Unification of Discrete, Gaussian, and Simplicial Diffusion, is officially out on arXiv! See this twitter thread for more.
